result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G Judd Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full.  Remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No Violent contact with: victim or with anyone.
Take Cognitive Thinking Course.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  20 Days - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.
To be completed within the First 10 months of Probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant did not report to Huber
Defendant to serve sentence of 20 days condition in jail, Huber revoked.
Wrong wording applied.
Defendant to serve sentence of 20 days condition time Huber with standard release conditions when apprehended.
dated 7/11/15 filed by the Sheriff Department; stating that Mr. Judd did not report to Huber
Pretrial Incarceration Credit sheet

Defendant Michael G Judd in court with Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Siepel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Schubert makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:    IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER - 1st 20 Days straight time - remainder with huber  (CREDIT - 1 day)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: victim or with anyone
____Cognitive Thinking course
____20 Hours of Community Service (to be completed within 1st 10 months of probation)


COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($300.00) and remainder to be returned to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  20 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 7/3/15 at 5:00 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
